Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Yodel \Yo"del\, Yodle \Yo"dle\, v. t. & i. [imp. & p. p. {Yodeled}, {Yodled}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Yodeling}, {Yodling}.] [G. jodeln.] To sing in a manner common among the Swiss and Tyrolese mountaineers, by suddenly changing from the head voice, or falsetto, to the chest voice, and the contrary; to warble. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Yodel \Yo"del\, Yodle \Yo"dle\, n. A song sung by yodeling, as by the Swiss mountaineers. [1913 Webster]

yodel n : a songlike cry in which the voice fluctuates rapidly between the normal voice and falsetto v : sing by changing register; sing by yodeling; "The Austrians were yodeling in the mountains" [syn: {warble}, {descant}] [also: {yodelling}, {yodelled}]
